snippet: Cardinal Joachim Meisner, the archbishop of Cologne whose conservative positions found him apologizing more than once during the years that he led Germany’s largest and wealthiest diocese, has retired, the archdiocese said Friday.
abstract: Archdiocese of Cologne, Germany, says that Cardinal Joachim Meisner has retired; Meisner's conservative positions found him apologizing more than once during the years he led Germany's largest and wealthiest diocese.
lead_paragraph: Cardinal Joachim Meisner, the archbishop of Cologne whose conservative positions found him apologizing more than once during the years that he led Germany’s largest and wealthiest diocese, has retired, the archdiocese said Friday.

headline.main: Archbishop of Cologne, Germany’s Largest Diocese, Retires
